reviews.review_msg: Haven't been able to stay awake for one class yet. A lot of the stuff he talks about seems random and pointless. He lied about our map quiz, saying we had to prepare to know 50 locations.. and ended up giving us over 120 !!! He seems like a nice guy and really knows his stuff but I don't think any of us got what we expected out of this course.

Michael is a very nice guy, although he is boring. The two exams are pure memorization. Its not that hard as people make it seem. The paper and presentation are easy and make up for it. Interesting for those who are into SE Asia. I recommend it. People who gave him bad ratings probaly did bad in the course. If you study his material you'll do fine.
very knowledgable and passionate about subject. would be better with more class participation. lots of memorization. not for those uninterested in se asia.

this is the worse class i have taken at SFU. shouldnt be under sa. first quiz is pure memorization of a map of SEA. dont really know what he's talking about in class because theres no text to read before classes until half way though the course. if you miss a lectue you're screwed for the quiz. handouts make no sense unless you go to class.

Despite his being an anthropology teacher I found him to be very old-school anth, meaning he is euro-centric (****/****) and makes comments such as "they are wild savages". NOT a good example of an anthropologist.
Tests require you to memorize an abundant of information. Tests are 20% - for the amount of studying required is simply ridiculous.

Do NOT take this course. If he didn't give marks based on attendance, I would never go to this class. Assigned textbook was written by him and is almost completely unrelated to test material. Doesn't tell you what he's looking for in papers/presentations.

This class is one of the most boring and useless classes I have ever taken. It is a COMPLETE waste of time, and he is one of the worst lecturers ever. I dont understand why we need to know such useless info. Everyone sleeps and dozes off in this lectures.

Do NOT take this class. Tests are brutal, you just memorize facts and places which are impossible. I didn't learn anything. He tells you what to study for on the test only 2 days in advance. Never responded to my e-mail. He's nice but shouldn't be a prof
Unfair marking scheme but very nice prof.  He helped me all the time and was very approachable.He loves what he does---thats for sure!

Would not recommend this class to anyone.  Marking scheme is very very unfair.  The tests are based on complete memeorization of facts that you do not even understand.  Too many small details and way to much memorization.  The only fun aspect-presentati

Think Mr. Rogers except unhelpful and more dull than usual. The whole class is based on your ability to memorize tedious lists of location names, but you never seem to learn anything about them. This class is a total waste of time and mental effort.
Reaally boring prof but nice guy and super easy marker. Material was strange and mostly facts to memorize but still one of my favorite classes. Good easy credit class.
way too much emphasis on memorization, lectures not helpful at all
totally useless, high school type information and assignments
Very very boring & uninteresting approach. An easy mark if you can stay awake.
